column4: Hiho, if got a problem with going full screen in games. When I start them my screen turns black and I get an "Analog - Out of Range - 80.8kHz / 65 Hz" Whereas the first number always changes to something between 80 and 85... anyone knows what could be the problem?
turn your refresh rate down on your monitor
should find what the optimum refresh rate is and resolution
it is on 50Hz in the resolutionoptions
I only can go for 50, 51 and 107
what about your game options?
I cant get there, it starts in full screen
I got the prob at SuperTux2 and Extreme Tux Racer
you haven't messed with any settings?
nah, I just installed ubuntu yesterday
and then the games
what do you have for a video card? Are there proprietor   drivers for your card
its the nVidia proprietor drivers
Did you enable the proprietor drivers for your card?
yes, the recommended one
androxoid1 hmmm
!xubuntu | goodbyeWindows
Im using a GeForce 6600 if that helps
I'm not sure what else to tell you, if your range settings are correct, I'm not sure what else could be the problem
where can I find those range settings?
try asking in #xorg they may be able to help you
alright thanks
have to google the make and model and serial number to see if you can find a match to find the specs
